title: Instant-runoff voting
summary: Instant-runoff voting (IRV) is a type of ranked preferential vote counting method used in single-seat elections with more than two candidates. IRV is also sometimes referred to as the alternative vote (AV),[1] preferential voting,[2][3] single transferable voting (New Zealand),[4]  or, in the United States, ranked-choice voting (RCV),[5] though these names are also used for other systems.[6][7][8][9]
